availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Constantin Riendenger (Campbell County, Kentucky, liquor retailer and soldier.)

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, liquor retailer and soldier. Native of Baden. Married to Catherine Kritz Riendenger in Campbell County, Kentucky, in December 1856. Father of Constantin Riendenger and John Riendenger. Served in the 42nd Kentucky Enrolled Militia (U.S.A) as a private from September 2, 1862 to September 17, 1862. Saloon keeper in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1863. Liquor retailer in Campbell County in 1864. Liquor retailer in Campbell County in 1865.

Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 17, Campbell County, Kentucky, 1864, p. 169.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994030, Campbell County Births, p. 165.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #12369.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Campbell County Marriages, Film #000465411, p. 73.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 872.
